Package frc.robot.subsystems.shooter

Class ShooterSubsystem

java.lang.Object
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
frc.robot.subsystems.shooter.ShooterSubsystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
public class ShooterSubsystem extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
Shooter subsystem for controller the shooter on the robot.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ShooterSubsystem()
    Initialize the shooter motors and double solenoid, while adding widgets to shuffleboard for shooter diagnostics.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShooterSubsystem

      public ShooterSubsystem()

  • Method Details

    • setPIDF

      public void setPIDF(frc.robot.subsystems.shooter.ShooterSubsystem.slotIdx profile, frc.robot.subsystems.shooter.ShooterSubsystem.pidIdx pid, double P, double I, double D, double F, double integralZone)
      Set the PIDF coefficients for the closed loop PID onboard the TalonSRX.
      Parameters:
      profile - The ShooterSubsystem.slotIdx to use.
      pid - The PID to use.
      P - Proportional gain for closed loop. This is multiplied by closed loop error in sensor units. Note the closed loop output interprets a final value of 1023 as full output. So use a gain of '0.25' to get full output if err is 4096u (Mag Encoder 1 rotation)
      I - Integral gain for closed loop. This is multiplied by closed loop error in sensor units every PID Loop. Note the closed loop output interprets a final value of 1023 as full output. So use a gain of '0.00025' to get full output if err is 4096u (Mag Encoder 1 rotation) after 1000 loops
      D - Derivative gain for closed loop. This is multiplied by derivative error (sensor units per PID loop). Note the closed loop output interprets a final value of 1023 as full output. So use a gain of '250' to get full output if derr is 4096u per (Mag Encoder 1 rotation) per 1000 loops (typ 1 sec)
      F - Feed Fwd gain for Closed loop. See documentation for calculation details. If using velocity, motion magic, or motion profile, use (1023 * duty-cycle / sensor-velocity-sensor-units-per-100ms)
      integralZone - Integral Zone can be used to auto clear the integral accumulator if the sensor pos is too far from the target. This prevents unstable oscillation if the kI is too large. Value is in sensor units. (ticks per 100ms)

    • setClosedLoopPeriod

      public void setClosedLoopPeriod(int ms)
      How fast the INTERNAL PID IS RUNNING (DOES NOT USE CAN!).
      Parameters:
      ms - period in milliseconds, should be 1.

    • setVelocityVoltageMaximumOutput

      public void setVelocityVoltageMaximumOutput(double maximumOutput)
      Set the max motor output.
      Parameters:
      maximumOutput - Absolute max motor output during closed-loop control modes only. A value of '1' represents full output in both directions.

    • setVelocityMaximumStep

      public void setVelocityMaximumStep(double maximumStepRPM)
      Set the maximum RPM that the motor can increase by.
      Parameters:
      maximumStepRPM - Cap on the integral accumulator in sensor units. Note accumulator is multiplied by kI AFTER this cap takes effect.

    • setShooter

      public void setShooter(double speed)
      Set the shooter power using percentage
      Parameters:
      speed - Shooter speed as a percentage.

    • setShooterVelocity

      public void setShooterVelocity(int targetVelocity)
      Set the shooter to a specified velocity using the primary PID
      Parameters:
      targetVelocity - Target velocity to send the shooter to using the PID specified during pid setup.

    • lowerHood

      public void lowerHood()
      Lower shooting hood for high shots.

    • raiseHood

      public void raiseHood()
      Raise shooting hood for low shots.

    • zeroEncoder

      public void zeroEncoder()
      Zero's the attached encoder to the shooter motor.

    • setStatusFrames

      public void setStatusFrames()
      Set status frames to the default period 20ms for PID 0 updates on the shooter motor.

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Periodic function running every 20ms.
